publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1419# Michael Matheson: Human Cloning-That the Parliament recognises the need for a far-reaching and thorough debate concerning human cloning; notes that the European Parliament has voted for a ban on human cloning; further notes that there are ethical alternatives to the use of stem cells from human embryos, and believes that Her Majesty's Government should withdraw any regulations which might implement the proposals of the Donaldson Report until the matter has been more fully debated. Supported by: Mr Gil Paterson*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Brian Adam*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Alex Neil*

S1M-1419# Michael Matheson: Human Cloning-That the Parliament recognises the need for a far-reaching and thorough debate concerning human cloning; notes that the European Parliament has voted for a ban on human cloning; further notes that there are ethical alternatives to the use of stem cells from human embryos, and believes that Her Majesty's Government should withdraw any regulations which might implement the proposals of the Donaldson Report until the matter has been more fully debated. Supported by: Mr Gil Paterson, Dr Winnie Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Mr Andrew Welsh*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*

Supported by: Mr Gil Paterson, Dr Winnie Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Mr Andrew Welsh, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Mr Duncan Hamilton
S1M-1419# Human Cloning (lodged on 4 December 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Irene McGugan*, Dennis Canavan*

Supported by: Mr Gil Paterson, Dr Winnie Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Alex Neil, Mr Andrew Welsh, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Irene McGugan, Dennis Canavan
